title.narrative: CELAM Integral development for a just, fraternal, inclusive Latin America and care of our common home

description.narrative: At the level of the universal Church, the synodal process is underway. In this context, the Council of Latin America Bishops' Conferences - CELAM is a strategic organisation seeking transformation to achieve "buen vivir" (living well) and integral ecology. The ongoing ecclesial renewal process represents huge potential for strengthening the Catholic Church to serve people throughout Latin America and the Caribbean. In 2019, under the leadership of the President of CELAM, Archbishop Miguel Cabrejos of Peru, and with strong encouragement from Pope Francis, a root and branch restructure of the organisation with support from CIDSE agencies, Caritas and Porticus. Whilst the COVID pandemic delayed the implementation of this process, the last two years have allowed CELAM to introduce better, decentralised ways of working, and more appropriate structures for overall leadership and coordination for the Church throughout the region to guide and strengthen its work for social justice and development with a gender perspective, to promote ongoing reflection among Church leaders and pastoral workers based on CST, Laudato Si and the Amazon Synod in order: To develop strategies and actions that respond effectively to the social, economic, political and environmental challenges facing the region. To train Church leaders and pastoral agents throughout Latin America on the Church’s option for the poor in the post-COVID context of increasing marginalisation and poverty, human rights violations, conflict, GBV, migration, environmental degradation and climate change, To provide tools and training to enable Church leadership and committed lay men and women to speak out with authority on issues of economic justice, peace-building and environmental and social protection. The overall priority is to strengthen a Church which goes forth (una Iglesia en salida) to engage with other civil society networks and all people of good will to work for justice and care of our common home.
